definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc

sentences.english: There is also a Children's Corner in our zoo.
sentences.chinese: 动物园里还有个儿童乐园。

sentences.english: A rural children's playground has more freedom in the design of space and facilities.
sentences.chinese: 乡村儿童乐园，其空间和设施的设计有更大的自由。

sentences.english: She's in the Children's Center of our clubhouse .
sentences.chinese: 她在我们会所的儿童乐园里。

sentences.english: Dad drove the car to the Children's Park.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸开车带她去了儿童乐园。

sentences.english: Sunday, the afternoon of the good dad and mom took me to the children's park to play.
sentences.chinese: 一个星期天下午，爸爸妈妈带我到儿童乐园玩。

sentences.english: Today, I was working at a children's play centre, and my stomach was twisting and turning.
sentences.chinese: 今天我正在儿童乐园里工作，忽然觉得肚子涨。

sentences.english: You may leave your children under qualified care in the children's playroom.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把小孩带到儿童乐园，在那能得到很好的看护。

sentences.english: Playground in Turkey where smaller families are now popular.
sentences.chinese: 土耳其的儿童乐园这里现在普遍是小家庭。

definition: sandpit (for children's play or for long jump etc)/sandbox
merry-go-round/carousel/Carousel, South Korean TV soap opera
traditional handcrafted toy (e.g. spinning top 陀螺[tuo2 luo2], tangram 七巧板[qi1 qiao3 ban3] etc) (Tw)
Disneyland/also written 迪士尼樂園|迪士尼乐园[Di2 shi4 ni2 Le4 yuan2]
